Dear Ms. Trotter:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
Jan 10 & 11, 2023. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. If I am unavailable and you need to speak to someone immediately, please
contact the area manager at (734) 395-0920.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is compliant with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4152 Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in the resident’s case
record: (a) Name, address, birth date, gender, race, height, weight, hair color,
eye color, identifying marks, religious preference, and school status.
(d) Name, address, and marital status of parents and name and address of
legal guardian, if known.
(e) Date of admission and legal status
Two of three initial placement outlines did not contain all of the items listed in
s ubpart (a), (d) and/or (e). Several items were left blank on the forms.
R 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan.
(3) The initial treatment plan shall include all of the following:
(f) Staff techniques for achieving the resident’s treatment goals, including a
specific behavior management plan. The plan shall be designed to minimize
seclusion and restraint and include a continuum of responses to problem
behaviors.
Three of three initial treatment plans did not document staff techniques for
a chieving the resident’s go als including specific behavior management plans.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each employee and shall
include documentation of all of the following information prior to employment or at
the time specified in this rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee’s performance within 30 days of the
completion of the probationary period or within 180 days, whichever is less,
and a written evaluation of the employee’s performance annually thereafter.
One of eight new employees did not have a probationary performance
evaluation within 180 days of hire. (Repeat violation: 2022 Interim with
C AP approved 3/3/2022 and 2021 Renewal with CAP approved 1/28/21)
1

R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(3) The licensee shall document that each staff person whose function is
covered by these rules has participated in a minimum of 50 clock hours of
planned training within the first year of employment and a minimum of 25 clock
hours of training annually thereafter related to the employee’s job function. At
least 16 of the 50 hours provided in the first year shall be orientation provided
prior to the assumption of duties.
Two of three direct care staff were not provided 25 hours of annual training in
2 022.
2.) The facility is compliant with all MISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is compliant with all MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
I provided 1:1 training to the new social service worker on CCI licensing rules and
how they correspond to documentation. I alerted the social service supervisor to
monitor areas of weakness. I provided rule interpretations related to employee
records to the new human resources staff. I explained how to document changes or
substitutions to the original meal menu.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
I verified that systems for due date tracking for treatment plans, psychotropic
medication consents, medical and dental exams were intact and discussed ideas for
plans of correction with the social service supervisor. I advised that school
enrollment dates be printed and maintained in the youth files.
2

EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There were no corrective action plans required during this licensing period.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
